text: Meessen De Clercq is a contemporary art gallery in Brussels, Belgium. The gallery is in an old building with three floors. In 2007, art historian Olivier Meessen and art lover Jan De Clercq began to work to start a contemporary art gallery in Brussels. In April 2008 the gallery opened, with a group show of works by seven artists. After this first show, the gallery closed to rebuild it. From September 2008 the gallery re-opened with group and solo shows by both older and new artists. == Artists == Artists who show their work include: * Ignasi Aballì * Susan Collis * Jordi Colomer * Hreinn Friðfinnsson * Filip Gilissen * Ellen Harvey * Adam Henry * Nicolas Lamas * Benoît Maire * Jorge Méndez Blake * Claudio Parmiggiani * Tania Pérez Cordova * Evariste Richer * Fabrice Samyn * Kelly Schacht * José María Sicilia * Thu Van Tran * Maarten Vanden Eynde * Leon Vranken ==References== ==Other readings== * * * ==Other websites== *Official website Category:Art Category:Belgian culture Category:Buildings and structures in Brussels
title: Meessen De Clercq
